09:06 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <DarkKnightCZ> events handled by observation module (local) are only local, right? (they are only triggered at one server instance)  
09:50 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:11 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: not exactly  
10:12 <tmortagne> remote event module receive all local event and then decide which one to send to other instances on the following criteria:  
10:14 <tmortagne> \* the event and all it's parameters are Serializable  
10:14 <tmortagne> \* a LocalEventConverter has been implemented for this event  
10:16 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: hmm, so if i create document when event occurs, how to avoid multiple creations?  
10:17 <tmortagne> note: XWikiContext is not considered as Serializable even if it implement Serializable, since it practive well trying to serialize it simply does not work (a pity the Java compiler does not have stringer validation for Serializable)  
10:18 <DarkKnightCZ> or the solution is to have event listener only on one node?  
10:18 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: you can check if the event is local or remote, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module+Remote#HCheckremoteevent  
10:18 <DarkKnightCZ> nice, thanks  
10:18 <tmortagne> or yes you organize your  instance to have only one to deal with this  
10:18 <tmortagne> your call

18:01 <woshilapin> Hi devs  
18:01 <woshilapin> I was just looking into the code of suggest.vm  
18:01 <woshilapin> And remark something weird  
18:01 <woshilapin> In all the queries is used 'prop.id.name = ?'  
18:02 <woshilapin> But in one of them, there is 'prop.name = ?'  
18:02 <woshilapin> Is it a forget?  
18:02 <woshilapin> (note that I didn't notice a bug linked to that but still, it seems weird !)  
18:11 <tekzilla\_> is now known as <tekzilla>  
18:12 <woshilapin> has quit

18:20 <vmassol> thanks
